duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide comprehensive veterinary care including wellness, surgery, senior pet care, dentistry, and urgent care services.
Communicate effectively with clients and collaborate with colleagues to ensure the best care for animal patients.
Demonstrate emotional intelligence and empathy in the delivery of care to pets and their owners.
Maintain accurate medical records and comply with all applicable laws and regulations.
Contribute to the development of clinic protocols and continuous improvement of patient care standards.

education_certification.credential: Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM/VMD) or equivalent degree required
State Veterinary Board License and in good standing for the state of employment prior to start date.
Active DEA license or DEA licensure eligible.
